title: Ticket #7055: overly large parallel jobs disrupt the SchedD
description:
If a user "accidentally" queues a parallel universe jobs with a large number of machines, the schedd suffers. We should prevent that from happening.

I propose a knob along the lines of "PARALLEL_UNIVERSE_MAX_SIZE" and param-table default it to 1024. Submit should fail if over the limit, but the admin can adjust it upward if needed.
remarks:
2019-May-17 14:35:30 by gthain:
I've pushed code that just prevents attempting to schedule any parallel job that requests more cpus than exist in the pool. No new knobs!

2019-May-17 14:50:45 by zmiller:
Even better. Down with knobs!

Plus then in approximately 12 years when a 2,222,226 node pool is as common as an 8,680 node pool is today, we'll be in good shape! :)
